artefact.overview: What you need to know to set up a charity and register it with the Charity Commission – including what to do if your charity is too small to register
artefact.body:
Register with the Charity Commission once your charity has an income of more than £5,000 per year – you can register online.

If you are thinking of setting up a registered charity

  1. Find out if registering as a charity is right for your organisation. Read the section ‘Is setting up a charity the right thing to do?’ on the Charity Commission website.

  2. Follow the Charity Commission’s guidance on registering a charity to make sure your application has the best chance of being accepted.

  3. Register online.

If your charity will have an income of less than £5,000 per year

The Charity Commission website includes help for people who want to set up a small charity.

You can still get tax relief as an unregistered charity. Get information about tax for charities from HM Revenue and Customs (HMRC).
